SENT.plain: Calciphylaxis is a frequent entity in patients with chronic renal failure of diverse etiology
The main pathogenic mechanism of calciphylaxis is impairment of either calcium and phosphate metabolism or plasma levels of parathyroid hormone

There are communications of patients with normal renal function, and in some cases with chronic inflammatory diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis, systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) and antiphospholipid syndrome
We report a patient with SLE and no renal failure or hyperparathyroidism who developed severe calciphylaxis
